title: Tomohiko Ikoma
text:
was a Japanese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and manager. He played for <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a>.
Club career.
Ikoma was born in <a href="Hyogo%20Prefecture">Hyogo Prefecture</a> on August 25, 1932. When he was a <a href="Kwansei%20Gakuin%20University">Kwansei Gakuin University</a> student, he won <a href="1953%20Emperor%27s%20Cup">1953</a> and <a href="1955%20Emperor%27s%20Cup">1955 Emperor's Cup</a> as a member of <a href="All%20Kwangaku">All Kwangaku</a> was consisted of his alma mater Kwansei Gakuin University players and graduates. After graduating from university, he joined <a href="Urawa%20Reds">Mitsubishi Motors</a> in 1955. In 1965, joined new league <a href="Japan%20Soccer%20League">Japan Soccer League</a>. He did not play in the league. He retired in 1966.
National team career.
On January 2, 1955, when Ikoma was a <a href="Kwansei%20Gakuin%20University">Kwansei Gakuin University</a> student, he debuted for <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> against <a href="Myanmar%20national%20football%20team">Burma</a>. He played 5 games for Japan in 1955.
Coaching career.
In 1966, when Ikoma played for <a href="Urawa%20Reds">Mitsubishi Motors</a>, he became a playing manager and managed the club 1 season. End of 1966 season, he resigned as manager and retired from playing career.
On April 27, 2009, Ikoma died in <a href="Kobe">Kobe</a> at the age of 76.
